My EVP research has not yet produced anything I could claim as paranormal,=
 which is why I have not posted any.=C2=A0 I also have not yet heard any ev=
idence here or elsewhere which convinced me that there was a paranormal ele=
ment involved.=C2=A0 Hence my current difference of opinion. Yet I continue=
 to listen.=C2=A0 How is that cynical? 

Frank, if I am reading your statem=
ents correctly, you seem take little account of my opinions, and accuse me =
of things like twisting words and making you look like an idiot, though I h=
ave not.=C2=A0=C2=A0 How is that not cynical?

'Cynics just disparage, and =
take little account of other opinions.=C2=A0=C2=A0 They
 often come across =
as arrogant when their beliefs are challenged.=C2=A0 They 
change topics wh=
en challenged or asked to consider objective testing, 
and accuse and insul=
t others.=C2=A0 "'

=C2=A0



  


    
      
    =
  
      =C2=A0So, you're saying you're a cynic?
=C2=A0
=C2=A0So where are =
your recordngs, and EVP examples?
=C2=A0
=C2=A0And this is the same debunke=
r ploy always used, twist words and statements around to make the one sdoin=
g this "research" look like total idiots. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0F-S


On Wed, May 2=
6, 2010 at 9:22 AM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 







There =
are researchers, cynics, and believers.

Cynics just disparage, and take li=
ttle account of other opinions.=C2=A0=C2=A0 They often come across as arrog=
ant when their beliefs are challenged.=C2=A0 They change topics when challe=
nged or asked to consider objective testing, and accuse and insult others.=
=C2=A0 


Researchers may or may not agree.=C2=A0 They are willing to accep=
t evidence for, and evidence against.=C2=A0 They are willing to change thei=
r opinion when the evidence supports it.=C2=A0 They are not afraid to chall=
enge statements, and are not afraid to have their own challenged.=C2=A0 The=
y value testing.


Believers seem to be at the other end of the spectrum as=
 cynics.=C2=A0 They take little account of other opinions. They often come =
across as arrogant when their beliefs are challenged.=C2=A0 They change top=
ics when challenged or asked to consider objective testing, and accuse and =
insult others.=C2=A0 


So in fact, Believers and Cynics are really the sam=
e, just with different beliefs.

s just the mind making sense out of meaningless patterns. It's not doing an=
y research or recordings, but sitting back telling the rest of us what is r=
eally going on in our heads. it's having these wierd little two way convers=
ions as if y'all know so much better--You and April

=C2=A0
=C2=A0F-S

at 8:24 AM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 







Frank, try not=
 to be so defensive when someone disagrees with you.

Not all alternate opi=
nions are 'debunking". Discussion, different processes, different viewpoint=
s, all add to research.=C2=A0 Everyone marching to the same tune, and all a=
greeing, doesn't.


If you want to say people hear different things because=
 of individualized messages, or psychic components, nothing is stopping you=
.=C2=A0 If someone else wants to say there is no psychic component, and tha=
t telling someone what they should hear can cause bias, they should be free=
 to. 


The brave ones will test their claims.=C2=A0 Those who make claims,=
 and insist they cannot be tested.. well... "most of us are smart enough to=
 know" (your term) what that really means.

=C2=A0
=C2=A0EVP is far more complicated than jus=
t cut and dried sounds, there=C2=A0is psychic component, where you're using=
 the sound as a psychic prop for your own senses. There's the messages tune=
d to a specific individual, so no one is going ot hear it the same if at al=
l. Everyone is wired different, and just because no two poeple hear an EVP =
the same does not invalidate it. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Maybe you should go debunk =
music, no one hears songs the same either. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Frank-S

unds (rather than radio-broadcast snippets), they still hear different thin=

rst.

Seems to me.
